result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mary M Joss was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Mary M Joss was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Mary M Joss was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Jail sentence for 120 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Placed in the Post Trial Supervision Program for a period of  12 Months.
Comply with all rules and recommendations of the program.

Conditions:

21 days credit

Defendant is entitled to begin second phase of home monitoring.
Jail sentence to commence within 60 days.
Obtain aDOT Assessment and comply with requirements of safety plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 1 Post trial Supervision Program

miscConds.notes: Pay costs. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Comply with any other recommendations  deemed appropriate by the agent with respect to counseling.

records.addlTxt: Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form
Granted /s/ RJS 03/11/16

Defendant Mary M Joss in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-480 and 15CT-267.

11:15 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

There is a plea agreement. In 15CM-480: Defendant is pleading to Count 1, 3 and 4.
Count 2 is being dismissed 

Atty Cousins states plea agreement for the record.
Atty Drengler concurs.

15CT-267: Dismissed and read in

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-480: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-480: Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-480: Count 4: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM-480: Count 1: Found GUILTY
15CM-480: Count 2: Dismissed
15CM-480: Count 3: Found GUILTY
15CM-480: Count 4: Found GUILTY
15CT-267: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court addresses the parties, concurs with joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:
15CM-480:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 120 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Placed in the Post Trial Supervision Program for a period of  12 Months
Conditions:
Jail sentence for 75 days
21 days credit
First 14 days in custody, balance on electronic home monitor
Defendant is entitled to begin second phase of home monitoring
Jail sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay a fine and costs totaling $3,976
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
35 Months Drivers License Revoked
35 Months IID
Obtain aDOT Assessment and comply with requirements of safety plan
Comply with all rules and recommendations of the program

Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 18 Months, concurrent to post trial supervision program in Count 1
Conditions:
AODA assessment and comply with recommendations
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Comply with any other recommendations  deemed appropriate by the agent with respect to counseling
Pay costs

Count 4:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 18 Months, concurrent to post trial supervision program in Count 1 and to Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 3
Pay costs

Atty Drengler presents to the Court an order for IID half price.
Court signs the order for half priced IID.

Motion, Stipulation and Order to Modify Conditions of Bond:

Modifying Bond:  Day Report reduced from 14 time per week down to 7 times per week. And excused from Day Report on 03-04-16. /s/RJS 02-05-16.
